website_summaries.verdict: While we'd like to see it cost a little less, Sennheiser has fixed the original Momentum's one weakness, making the new 2.0 Momentum not only sound slightly better but fit more comfortably.
pros: The Sennheiser Momentum 2.0 offers more spacious and softer earcups, making it a more comfortable headphone
It offers excellent, refined sound, high-end build quality, and a new folding design
An inline remote/microphone is  included for cell-phone use (Apple iOS and Android friendly versions are available) along with a nice carrying case
cons: should include cables for both iOS and Android devices in the box

customer_reviews.title: Very well done
customer_reviews.text: I've always had trouble finding headphones that I can wear for extended times while working at my desk. These are very comfortable, sound great and do very well at keeping the noise from what I'm listening to from being heard by anyone else. Only down side is it's difficult to "feel" which button I'm clicking on the cord without looking. The middle one is larger than the up/down buttons but it's still not easy to tell. I'm falling in to a habit of feeling the right one but it's still difficult.
customer_reviews.author: pccoder

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, except 2.5mm cable.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, amazing sound, great bass, treble and mids (much better than V-MODA Crossfade M-100) Super light and super comfortable.(much better than V-MODA Crossfade M-100) One negative thing is the 2.5mm input on the headphones, which makes it much harder(==more expensive) to find compatible cables. The stock cable is flimsy. If you can leave with 2.5mm cable, buy it. Note. Currently Apple version is $85 cheaper than Android. Buy it for Android and get the cable which is $30. == Saving $50. The Apple and Android headphones are identical, it's only about the controls on the cable. No matter which version you take, sound will work with either Apple or Android devices.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great well-rounded pair of headphones with a sleek design
customer_reviews.text: I got the Sennheiser Momentum 2.0s for Apple Devices in ivory white, and after several weeks of using them, I have to say that I’m really satisfied with them. First of all, it has a really sleek design, with a metal headband and ivory housing. The headband folds in, making it convenient to carry around in the provided case. The ear pads are quite soft and fit comfortably, but they do still heat up and hurt the ears slightly after prolonged periods of time. It has a very clear, well-rounded and authentic sound quality, making it suitable for a wide range of genres, though I find it particularly suitable for bassier electronic music
customer_reviews.author: Sting

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an over the ear headset to use for traveling and to tune people out on my commute to work on transit. While this headset doesn't have active sound canceling, it still does a great job at blocking your ears from outside sound with the comfortable leather padding. I have worn these for almost an entire day straight and felt no discomfort from the head band or the over ear padding, and I even have a big head. Very comfortable to use with great sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tormoen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Definitely better than Bose or Beats
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Definitely better than Bose or Beats. I had some Polk Audio ones, which were superior to Bose and Beats as well. However, the build quality was lousy. So, I got these after a while of just living without good sound. At first, I thought they were inferior to the Polk ones on bass and I set the bass booster on the iphone to "on." However, as they broke in, the sound quality, especially the bass, kept getting better and better. I wear them A LOT. So, the one thing lacking in these is that the head band can become a bit uncomfortable, as there is no padding on it. Still, very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Prism

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price - disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've been on the radio for twenty years and love great music. Headphones are my life. I've had luck with Sennheiser before and believed the reviews of this headset, but it was a total disappointment. Average at best. I've never spent more than $400 for headphones but splurged and paid $2,000+ for a different brand. Wow! Now I know why people spend an insane amount for headphones. Lesser headphones don't reproduce all the music. The more you pay (up to a point) the more you hear. So skip these and save up your money. Spend as much as you can afford.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Rich dynamic sound
customer_reviews.text: these are my favorite portable headphones. The sound is overall rich and dynamic. Bass is punchy, deep and impactful, the mids are clear and right where they should be. The treble is a little dark. Cymbals sometimes sound pushed back in the mix.They could use a little more detail on top, but at least it is never harsh or grating or offensive. The sound of these headphones are right in my wheelhouse because they sound very much like the HD 650, which is an open back phone I really like.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Marc Axelrod

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The isolation on these is crazy. Save $100 on noise cancelling "technology" and just go with incredibly comfortable ear cups. Overall, the drivers are pretty flat* in response, handling lows and highs equally well. The sub-30Hz-ish range, unsurprisingly, is thin, but for a "clean" sound, they can carry bass-heavy music tastes (with a little EQ help). The construction seems solid. The wires from the headband to the drivers likely are the weakest link - or, maybe, the proprietary 1/8" jack. Assuming the leather holds up, these classically-styled cans will look as good as they sound for years. Since these were a gift, I'll update as necessary... or get my own. *Tested on a phone playing FLACs.
customer_reviews.author: EBE

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase in Years
customer_reviews.text: I LOVEEEEE these headphones! Previously have had Bose and Beats and these are by far the best quality. The leather ear cups make a huge difference in comfort if you tend to listen for prolong periods of time (I use them mostly at work). They are also fairly easy to clean and the carrying case it comes with is the perfect size. My only comment is the cord is not as durable as I would like, I have had to buy a replacement one every year since purchasing but I also use the headphones nearly everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Isaac

customer_reviews.title: EXCELENT!!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELENT!!!! Luxury packaging, luxury headphones, luxury sound. I tested with my Samsung Galaxy S4, with my Galaxy Tab S, and with a Dell Inspiron 15 series 7000. Balanced sound, realy confy. My whole ear gets inside the cushions so during my trip to work by train I only feel vibrations of the train, no voices or sounds of outside world. No need a noise canceling with batteries, this cans realy works. I listen different genres of music, from powermetal (Helloween) to 80s pop or 90s hard rock, ALL SOUND AWESOME!!! I used a lot of headphones in my DJ years, Momentum 2.0 realy rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Diego Pistoletti Dovenna

customer_reviews.title: and it becomes better and better
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 48 hours, and it becomes better and better. Very rich sounds, beautiful bass and rich mid frequency, crispy high frequency. Perfect headset for Pop. If you enjoy bass only, this maybe not the best one. However, if you enjoy most of the music and have a wide range of taste, you will love this one. Beyond its performance, I also like its outlook. The two metal legs are just so cool. Wearing this for 3 hours, no pain or sweat or other uncomfortable issue, and I am wearing glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: they sounded good, but after listening for too long (over an ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a pair of Audio Technica ATH-MX50. they sounded good, but after listening for too long (over an hour), my ears would get very hot and begin to hurt a bit. I wanted something that sounded as good or better, but was super comfortable. These are it! They sound better than my old phones, and they are much more comfortable for long listening periods. These also have the phone mic which is a plus compared to my old AT's. They are a bit pricy, but well worth the one time cost if you use them often.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Great even for non Audiophiles
customer_reviews.text: I am not a audiophile and have "average" ears. But I can tell the difference between listening on these and any other headphone speaker. The clarity and range on these headphones was amazing. For Music you get strong bass but are still able to easily pick out higher pitch details. Games are equally clear from explosions to hearing someone change clips on around the corner the headphones handle it all easily. I got Like New ones and at ~$165 best audio investments I have made.
customer_reviews.author: D. Federwitz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and good, neutral sound quality. Relatively small earcups
customer_reviews.text: Previously I used a pair of Audio-Technica M50x headphones, and the sound quality on these Sennheisers are much superior compared to the relatively bass-heavy M50xs. The packaging is quite sturdy and folds pretty small for travel. I had no issues with the protection level of the soft case included with these headphones, they're sturdy enough to be thrown into luggage without worry. The ear cups on these are noticeably smaller than the M50s, and some with larger ears may find them uncomfortable. However, the headband tension is low and these headphones otherwise feel extremely comfortable worn for long periods.
customer_reviews.author: Paige F.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Ear pads hurt after an hour.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound absolutely great. The problem is that after about an hour, the ear pads feel like they're putting too much pressure on my ears and they begin to hurt so badly I have to take them off. Same thing with the part that rests on top of my head. Too bad they're just not comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: The Croatian Sensation

customer_reviews.title: I have had it for years and it works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.text: The quality this can provide to a decent set up is great. Even if you do not have an amp the experience is still amazing. I've been using it daily for as long as ive had it and have never been disappointed. The only thing I would say is change the cable, buy a better connector cable and youll feel much happier.
customer_reviews.author: StreetlampTV

customer_reviews.title: Quality craftsmanship and stellar sound!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and comfort! Connects directly to my Mac Pro at work and the sound is crisp and clear. Bass is not as deep and pronounced but these still deliver a very nice low tone without being overbearing. I have not needed an amp, where my previous headphones, AKG K701 did require one for sufficient sound quality. Love the comfort and feel, they are reasonably light for quality headphones and can be worn for long periods without getting warm.
customer_reviews.author: RubenC

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, great sounding pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, great sounding pair of headphones. Definitely not meant for studio monitor use, but provide a nice listening experience for everything from jazz to alternative rock. They comfortably fit over my rather large ears, and the fact that they are so light means that you can wear them for hours on end. One caveat; if you are a bass-head or very hard on your headphones, I would recommend getting the v-moda m100's instead.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Topping

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones, awful comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I must say these headphones are some of the best headphones I ever owned; only one problem that force me to give it 4 stars is the fact how uncomfortable it is if you have bigger ears then the average person. The ear cups are too small for me and not deep enough. So my ears are being rubbed against the driver as well as the ear cups themselves. I can only use them for about an hour at a time before my ears gets red and it becomes painful to wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: 2 when they were released - and I am very pleased, bright
customer_reviews.text: I've previously owned the Momentum version 1, and the Bowers and Wilkins P7 headphones. The ver. 1 momentum hurt my ears especially being one who wears glasses. The P7's just didn't articulate as well as I hoped, perhaps I had a defective pair because everyone swears by them. Anyway, I promptly picked up the ver. 2 when they were released - and I am very pleased, bright, articulate, and warm sounding with digital input. The low end is pretty subtle, but I think that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Of Course best quality of headphones brand is SENNHEISER!!!
customer_reviews.text: i used many headphones but it is awesome. its sound is brilliant. i want to buy sennheiser's headphones and buy it. i really happy for buy it. when i listened to music by momentum 2 , i didn't anything . maybe i heared very little . + elegant design quality material genuine leather ear pads good sennheiser case quality sound noise isolation - price high but it is sennheiser so it is normal Of Course i m suggesting to momentum 2 . don't waiting and must buy momentum 2 !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: TAHA

customer_reviews.title: Yup, Good sound!
customer_reviews.text: I have been listening to the momentum2 for a few weeks now. They are well broken. Obviously, when using high bit rate, well done studio recordings, this headphones sound great. I listen for hours at a time and they feel comfortable. My ears fit within the cushions. My Iphone7 Plus + Audioforge equalizer + excellent studio recordings = high satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones that fit all the way around my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones that fit all the way around my ears (larger than the the 1st gen).I wear them all day at work and use them for both listening to music as well as for making phone calls (with a separate mic). I do need to adjust them hear and there throughout the day to keep them comfortable but have yet to have them cause a headache. I wear glasses and these do not put too much pressure on the frames or my ears.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is outstanding the best of any headphones I’ve tried. The volume control takes a little getting used to. Once you get the hang of it no problem. Excellent sound very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: ken wheeler

customer_reviews.title: I think it's safe to say this will be your best pair.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not gonna pretend I'm some audiophile here, but I do work in voiceover, so I understand the need for quality equipment. I put on a song I knew very well, that I've been listening to for over a decade, with an old (crappy) pair of headphones. After that I used my new pair of Sennheiser Momentum 2.0s and I was hearing instruments and vocals I had never heard before! Such clarity in the sound. It's as if every instrument is appreciated and the breadth of the music is all the more vast. Quality product. If you've never purchased pricey and or high quality headphones before, I think it's safe to say this will be your best pair.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: These are every bit as good as the IE80's and have amazing crisp sound while ...
customer_reviews.text: These are every bit as good as the IE80's and have amazing crisp sound while packing a precise, powerful bass. They tend to make your ears warm over a long time, and the soundstage could be a little better. But the quality is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: JKW

customer_reviews.title: They sound great although the clamping pressure is a little too much ...
customer_reviews.text: They sound great although the clamping pressure is a little too much starting out of the box, so I would recommend getting a headphone stand that keeps it stretched out to your head shape, or you could put the headphones on the box it comes in overnight, and it should stretch out as well; although, I bought a stand to avoid finding out if that would over do it.
customer_reviews.author: Mattack

customer_reviews.title: Durable with accurate crisp sound
customer_reviews.text: It has been a full year since I've purchased these and I use them everyday through workouts and general use. Not only is the sound quality exceptional but they are comfortable and have proven to be very durable; there's literally not even a scratch on these. Very good product as expected from Sennheiser. Sound is very accurate and even with crisp high tones, deep bass but not overpowering like beats.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Sell your Beats, get real headphones
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound on the go, sounds even better with a small amp/dac if you want to use them at a desktop. My HD598 and these are the only 2 headphones I need. I even sold my PXC550 because I loved the sound of these so much more (as expected).
customer_reviews.author: Charles O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, warm ears
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is fantastic, as others have noted. They may get a slightly sweaty around the ears during a muggy nyc episode. In winter, they act as very decent ear muffs. Listening to Led Zepplin or the Notorious BIG on these is a dreamboat. Even classical music comes out rich.
customer_reviews.author: IB

customer_reviews.title: I liked this headphones but found them lacking in the bass ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked this headphones but found them lacking in the bass department too much for my taste...the sound great, just needed more...tried V-Moda crossfades and B&W P7s, ended up with the latter as my go tos. The Momentums were almost there for me, but even with headphone amp just not quite enough to keep me happy.
customer_reviews.author: BKDMino

customer_reviews.title: Best headphone in this price range!
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones, very comfortable to wear. I listen to a wide range of music, progressive rock, classic rock, jazz and some blues. For listening on your phone or iPad these work very well. I also have the HD 800 which require an amp and are a whole different headphone experience. For most music lovers these are excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Expert

customer_reviews.title: Suits my needs
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile by any means, but this is the most astoundingly excellent pair of headphones that I have ever owned. Stylish, comfortable, and outputs incredible sound. Worth every single penny. Try before you buy at a Best Buy or some other store that previews headphones; some people have different preferences.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel L. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Best Mobile Cans on the market
customer_reviews.text: Amazing set of cans. Deep, crisp sound. Outperform my Bose Quiet Comforts by a long shot. I use these on airplane trips frequently and they are just as good as cutting down noise as any of the active canceling cans on the market. Best set of mobile headphones I've ever owned and I have owned many. Buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Toby W. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for a few years now. Excellent sound, solid construction. The only downside is the flimsy cable, but you can purchase a solid replacement right here on Amazon as the other reviewers recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Boulgakov

customer_reviews.title: ... these headphones now for over three months and am happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have had these headphones now for over three months and am happy with my purchase. The Sennheiser Momentum 2.0 headphones have metal components in critical places on the band like in the hinges to keep the headband from snapping which is an issue I have had with other brand headphones. As far as sound quality they performed better than I expected, the Sennheiser Momentum 2.0 is not a flat set of headphones as they slightly overemphasize low end frequencies but this is still done in a tasteful fashion that leads to a positive listening experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: These provide good sound with low-powered devices
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use with my phone and laptop, instead of earbuds, which I find uncomfortable. These provide good sound with low-powered devices. They fold up pretty well, but of course are larger than most mobile solutions. I use other headphones, with different specs, for my home entertainment system.
customer_reviews.author: Bob C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely in love with this headphones.The sound is perfect! Very comfortable and noise isolating, The two carrying cases (pouch and a soft zip-up) both are excellently made. Headphones are portable, so it's great for travel.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sound great.
customer_reviews.text: The Momentums have been very comfortable and the sound quality is very good. I did purchase the Audio-Technica ATH-MSR7's previous to getting this pair. I do think I would give the edge in sound quality to the MSR7's. They offered a very clean and natural sound, but they were too tight, heavy and uncomfortable for me to wear for extended periods of time. I like the way the Momentums look and fit. They feel like they are built really well too. The sound is a bit more fun or warming sounding and not overly bass heavy like some other headphones on the market tend to be.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L. Robison

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement
customer_reviews.text: Now this is quality. Sounds great out of the box. Will only get better over time with burn in. Light weight and feels like a much more expensive headphone. Much more comfortable than first generation Momentums.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Willie

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not that nice
customer_reviews.text: After using these a few weeks I wish I'd bought a different set. They are nice, but not 250$ nice. Just don't feel like they are as good as they were reviewed to be despite watching 10-15 video reviews on them
customer_reviews.author: kifer

customer_reviews.title: Nice luxury cans for easy listening
customer_reviews.text: Very balanced sound, wish the bass hit a little harder, but have other cans for extreme bass. Very comfortable on ears, build quality is exquisite. Very attractive headphones, like the luxury look and feel. Leather ear pads are soft as butter. Bought the android remote cord separately, should be included at no cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Isaac

customer_reviews.title: They sound great, they look great.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable and great-sounding headphones that in the ivory/brown color are also the best-looking phones on the market, with nice brushed steel accents and minimal branding. If I have one reservation it's that the sound isolation just isn't quite as good as we're lead to believe; they could probably benefit from the active noise cancellation that you get with the Bluetooth version.
customer_reviews.author: Cruz Azul

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and amazing comfort
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. Best I've ever had. Comfortable, soft, amazing sound quality, and perfect. Pros: - Very comfortable fit over the ears, can wear for hours with no discomfort at all - Soft leather ear cushions - Adjustable fit for different head sizes - Travel case included - Not technically noise-cancelling but the cushions are a snug fit and reduces outside ambient noises Cons: - Can't think of any at the moment...
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable and sound fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones daily while working. I absolutely love the sound and all day comfort of these. Wish I had ordered these sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but not big enough for my ears.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but not big enough for my ears. Best sounding headphones I've had, but after 15 minutes of listening it would cause me discomfort. They were the updated version, with larger cups, but apparently they not large enough yet. Maybe version 3.0 does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel Ribas

customer_reviews.title: Good quality headphone
customer_reviews.text: Good quality headphone, premium build with leather and stainless steel. Impactful bass with a little roll off treble, a Sennheiser sound signature. Very Stylist, definitely recommend for casual listener that demand look and sound quality on the go.
customer_reviews.author: tom_tran

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these. I have a pair of HD650s but I'll often grab these because they're so comfortable. They fold up nicely for travel and sound great with my FiiO X3. I found after I bought them that you can purchase a cable for Android so they really support both.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: INCREDIBLE HEADPHONES! I listen to electronic music, and the Bass carries clearer than any other high end Sony or Bose headphones I have tried. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: adr

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality with a comfortable design
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are excellent. They fit comfortably over my ears, I can wear them for a long time without getting a headache, and best of all, they're Sennheisers, so they sound amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Martin C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cans for a portable hifi experience.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, these cans sound great through my LG V20. I bought these specifically for this phone because of the low impedance. My other cans were 400 ohm, and even though my phone ramps up output voltage when high impedance cans are used, I still had to use an outboard dac/amp to have decent volume levels. This was the single, best, truly portable hifi investment I've made.
customer_reviews.author: My sofa pulls out but i dont.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome with Oppo HA-2 and Moon Audio Silver Dragon
customer_reviews.text: Own both Momentum V1 and now V2 and yes party people the annoying almost over-ear pads in V1 have now been successfully tweaked to perfection. Huge fan of these cans, almost unbelievable how good they sound through modern mobile devices. I, however, like a dork currently run them though a 128 64-bit iPod Touch linked via Lightning to an Oppo HA-2. To think one could walk through a crowed international airport listening to 192/24 tracks through these head phones and with this sound quality, and it is mobile, is extraordinary. I also recommend a Moon Audio's Silver Dragon lead with these, brings out one more layer of detail and fidelity.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.text: The cups didn't cover my ears fully and they start to cause some pain after a little bit. So right now they're gathering dust. The sound was excellent but the comfort not so much.
customer_reviews.author: G. T. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Headphone happiness
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I am very happy. Not only do they sound good ,they look good. A big improvement over the first momentum especially in the comfort department. I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Soundwise sounds great with tighter bass (and less mid-bass bleed)
customer_reviews.text: Larger earcups make for a much improved fit over the first generation Momentum. Soundwise sounds great with tighter bass (and less mid-bass bleed), airier treble and larger soundstage.
customer_reviews.author: I. L.

customer_reviews.title: Good headphone for commutes
customer_reviews.text: Good headphone for commutes. They are comfortable for closed back headphones, light in weight, and fold for bag storage. The bass frequency response is strong, but that's OK when trying to overcome the drone of engines and crowd noise. They are relatively noise isolating. I would wouldn't recommend for home use – open back would be better – but you wouldn't be able to take those outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headset. Let me begin by telling you that ...
customer_reviews.text: Great headset. Let me begin by telling you that I don't have much to compare. I do own a few pair of headphones ranging from $50 to $150 Amazon prize earplugs. The headset is very comfortable to wear. I had mine on for over 8 hours. I got the around the ears set and it blocks off normal conversation around my work place. Music were set at low to medium. The container that it comes with is bulky. So I just use the bag that it comes with. Like many reviewers have posted, I do re-listen to most of my music again. This headphones do bring out the sound that I never heard from my $100 earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Bobo

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought it when it is 200. Used for more than half year. Everything is great for me. Build quality is top notch. The sound is great too, although I'm not any expert on this area, it is good enough for me. The ivory one is also stylish. Definitely recommend this if the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Yunfei Zhao

customer_reviews.title: One of the best portable media headset i have ever brought
customer_reviews.text: Pros: One of the best portable media headset i have ever brought. A German-made Sennheiser's quality makes most Beats Headphones jokes. Besides the good sound quality, wearing it for too long won't come along with major discomfortability, unless you are sweating, which is one of the flaws of its previous generation product. Cons: Its a bit hard for tempering, if you are a pro in seeking its maximum performance. Still it deserves a 5 Star review.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Nice tight bass and clear high notes
customer_reviews.text: Nice tight bass and clear high notes. Very natural sounding headphones which I could listen to for hours without tiring. The set that arrived from Amazon Prime would lose the right side intermittently but it was exchanged pretty quickly at Sennheiser in Sydney, Australia without any hassles. Very impressive international warranty. The lesson here is to buy from authorised dealers like Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: overall excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: A much welcome improvement on comfort (I could not wear the last version), the sound signature has an emphasis on the low frequency, overall excellent sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: CarlosUNKNOWN

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE. I chose to buy a pair of ...
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE. I chose to buy a pair of these as my first set of upscale over-ear headphones, and I was NOT disappointed. They're amazing, and I love the protective case they come with. My only complaint is that the band presses down somewhat uncomfortably on the top of my head after I've been wearing them a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ros

customer_reviews.title: Gooood.
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile and I can't describe these things in their lingo, but I know what sounds good and what doesn't and these sound very good. I hear parts of songs I've listened to a thousand times and never noticed, background vocals, subtle cymbals, etc. Plus they're incredibly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: I think if you are into warm and bassy these are amazing. If you don't know what soundstage is
customer_reviews.text: At 150 def worth a snag, I think if you are into warm and bassy these are amazing. If you don't know what soundstage is, don't be afraid the little bit that there is is enough to surprise you. Are these the best no!, but are these worth the money, yes!
customer_reviews.author: santiago Lara

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great. The only disappointment is the placement of the volume control. It is too high on the wire and you can't see it so it is just by feel; I'm sure that I will get used to it but in the interim it is clumsy.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Srdich

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I am not an audiophile but I think I might become one after receiving these. I had an equivalent pair from that huge company that Apple bought, and they were crap compared to these, at same price. These make you want to flip through all your favorite music to see what you have been missing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gambill

customer_reviews.title: puts a smile on my face
customer_reviews.text: I bought these two years ago and they still surprise me every now and then. The cleaner the source of music, the better they get. I am really glad I got them

customer_reviews.title: They sound amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Can only wear for an hour or two before the headphones become uncomfortable. They sound amazing.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: My favourite headphones!
customer_reviews.text: My favourite headphones I've ever bought. My only regret is that Apple is taking away the headphone port on their devices....

customer_reviews.text: Am sorry i really wanted to like them but the earcups ARE TOO FREAKIN SMALL. Maybe for small ears it would work. Sound quality is good.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, but headband isn't padded enough for me
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, but headband isn't padded enough for me. I have a small head and this hurts it after a while.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Love it! Love it! And it is finally on discount! I immediately ordered it when I saw the discount... Works great with all types of music. Highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Today sound in a retro structure headphone
customer_reviews.text: Great head phone, not as much bass as I wanted but these are definitely comfortable and enjoyable.

customer_reviews.title: Great for plane/train travel: your neighbor can't hear a thing
customer_reviews.text: Besides the great sound: if you travel on planes or trains a lot, know that the person next to you can't hear a thing even if the volume is high. That is a huge bonus.
customer_reviews.author: ViaVija

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for one of my staff as a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for one of my staff as a reward and he loves them. They are the envy of the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Trakkar Clay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, easy to use, no amp/DAC needed. It works perfectly with my iPhone and PC.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: One thing worth mentioning is that it could make you ears hurt after a while because of your ears making contact with the hard driver shells. But it is probably not enough of a flaw to take a star off, a number of portable headphones have these kinds of problems. Overall decent looking, great sounding pair of cans, I would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and superior comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality and superior comfort! Very impressed and definitely a step up from beats or the beyerdynamic custom 1 pro that hurt your head after 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Voskov

customer_reviews.title: These sounded delightful but the cups were a bit too ...
customer_reviews.text: These sounded delightful but the cups were a bit too small for my ears, I coughed up the extra cash and went for the Oppo PM3 instead.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile but these sound great in my opinion. They are also very comfortable.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and great quality travel headphones
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and great quality travel headphones. Sound great through my Nexus 6p and even better when paired with my Fiio E18
customer_reviews.author: Philip Wren

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality and super comfortable to wear for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Liu

customer_reviews.title: Honest sound reproduction.
customer_reviews.text: Nice balanced sound. Not bass heavy, but not bass shy. Vocals are clear and realistic. Full sized cushions are very comfortable and easy to adjust. Best I've ever had.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: Great headphones so far I am very happy would tell people to buy these German headphones
customer_reviews.author: Tod Shuss

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and I can wear them with my glasses for long periods of time without feeling pain. They are built well. I love the quality especially when I am listening to instrumentals.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Yau

customer_reviews.title: But they get more comfortable every day
customer_reviews.text: This is my first foray into nicer headphones. Prior to this, I was using cheap in-the-ear headphones. There's been a bit of the break-in period; my ears aren't quite adjusted to over-the-ear headphones. But they get more comfortable every day. These are very nice looking and are definitely high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun B

customer_reviews.title: Decent Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Headphones have always been a weakness of mine, I own too many pairs because each one is suited for things just a little bit better than the prior. These were purchased for traveling. I love their look, I like that they have a mic, that they're closed and had a low impedance. They're comfortable, even with long listening sessions, they're not heavy and the pads are soft. the sound quality is quite good, not sell your stereo good, but you won't want to punch yourself and others while listening with them. They also came with a good quality case, which I appreciate. All in all, a great pair of headphones that I carry with me.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Let them brun in! No, really.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound. At first I was a bit disappointed, but once I had listened to them for a while I was really happy with them. Burn in is a real thing, its not just audiophile snake oil, and these headphones benefit greatly from it.
customer_reviews.author: Danilo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've had the same pair for 3 years. Have put these through the wringer (i listen to music loud) and they still sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Davis

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are great. Hopefully you get them in the right color ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great. Hopefully you get them in the right color - Amazon delivered them in the wrong color to me twice in a row.
customer_reviews.author: Kavika

customer_reviews.title: Love these. I'm in a studio setting up to ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I'm in a studio setting up to 5 hours a day and there is a lot going on around us. Originally, I was looking at noise cancellation headphones but quickly realized what I really wanted was true sound reproduction as the priority. Excellent sound in these and the comfort and classic look are bonus.

customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones! Great bass, beautiful mids and good treble. Definitely worth the money. Great bang for the buck! Best portable headphones on the market. Build quality is also top notch!

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphone
customer_reviews.text: Are the best headphones I ever got in my life recommended to all my family members

customer_reviews.text: Awesome $200 over the ear headphone! Thouroughly researched; best in it's price range.

product_meta.title: Sennheiser Momentum 2.0 for Samsung Galaxy - Black (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: The second generation MOMENTUM headset brings signature Sennheiser sound to an updated iconic design. Premium components like the stainless steel headband and real leather covered headband and ear cushions illustrate precision craftsmanship and exude luxury. The new folding headband design provides greater portability. The new slightly larger ear cups feature ergonomically designed, memory foam cushions for improved ambient noise isolation and extreme comfort during long listening sessions. A single-sided detachable cable incorporates an inline remote and mic for controlling music and taking calls. Two versions are available, one for Apple iOS devices and another for Samsung Galaxy devices and most other Android smartphones and tablets. Gen 2 MOMENTUM again raises the performance bar for premium mobile headsets.
feature_bullets: Closed back, over-ear model provides noise isolation and listening comfort in a compact, lightweight design
In-line smart 3 button remote and mic on the cable are compatible with most smartphones and portable players (including Galaxy and most Android devices)
Sennheiser engineered 18-ohm transducers deliver wide frequency response and high output levels when connected to portable audio devices
Foldable stainless steel headband makes it easy to pack and store so Momentum can travel with you.
Detachable cable must be inserted until it "clicks" and twisted clockwise (to the right) to lock the cable in place.
Two year warranty when purchased from an authorized Sennheiser dealer
